sub_title: lecturer rural development and innovation at Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences
summary:
Voor optie Nederlandse versie van LinkedIn: zie bovenaan rechts

My main professional objective is to stimulate and support a better economic and social position of rural communities, both internationally as in The Netherlands. I work worldwide in the domain of rural development and agriculture with a focus on food security through a.o. organised farmers. I believe that climate smart agriculture practices is a way to build resilience among rural communities and to ensure food security also for vulnerable groups in society. There is a prominent place for young people, the future builders of rural resilience.

I am a person that relates strategic policies to the practical situation in the field using my entrepreneurial skills. Coaching, advising, lecturing and training are important aspects of my day-to-day work. As lecture/project manager/coordinator I achieve intended results while dealing with a variety of projects and processes at the same time. My colleagues see me as stimulating, enthusiastic and a pro-active team player. I have a learning attitude.

My ambition is to work with my colleagues and my continuous expanding network in all circles of society on finding sustainable solutions to rural poverty. My intention is to play a meaningful role in this by making use of innovative actions and practices worldwide.

Representatives of environmental organisations, students and other interested parties of WUR discussed relevant statements including "The goal becomes not to build a few gigantic green solutions, but to infinitely multiply smaller ones”. The debating groups concluded that not taking any action is no alternative anymore as time is running out.
